paragraphs: I'm a systems-oriented software engineer who builds low-level infrastructure, deterministic pipelines, and developer tooling that prioritizes reliability, debuggability, and structured outputs over magic. I move comfortably between bare-metal-ish thinking and high-level abstractions when it actually makes sense.

Most of my work sits at the intersection of distributed systems, real-time synchronization, and applied AI â€” lately focusing on agent architectures, GPU-accelerated compute, and slowly orbiting back toward robotics and simulation.

experiences.title: AI Agentic R&D Intern - NTT GDC
experiences.description: Built 'Judge', a real-time LLM guardrail and policy evaluation engine that reduced evaluation latency by 83%. Researched MCP and designed prototype multi-agent and single-agent hybrid architectures focused on reliability and controllability for enterprise AI systems.

projects.title: Judge / PolicyTree
projects.description: Unified Safety & Authorization Engine. A guardrail framework combining content moderation, RBAC, and agent tool-governance under a single policy abstraction. Uses an async tree-based policy evaluator with parallel SLM execution and deterministic outputs.

projects.title: WeatherGPT
projects.description: AI-powered weather intelligence platform combining transformer-based forecasting with conversational interfaces (Gemini). Integrates real-time data from Open-Meteo and features a modern dark-mode UI using shadcn/ui.

projects.title: PR Agent
projects.description: Automated code review system that analyzes Pull Requests using a graph-based agent workflow to surface logic, security, and performance issues with severity-scored suggestions.

projects.title: Axle File Sync
projects.description: Peer-to-peer real-time file synchronization system for local teams and hackathons. Uses Git for diffs, Redis pub/sub for instant change propagation, and focuses on fast iteration rather than long-term cloud hosting.

writings.title: Decentralized Digital Identity: A Blockchain and Neural Network Approach
writings.description: Featured research in Premier Journal of Science (2025). Explores integrating neural network technologies with blockchain-powered decentralized identity management.

writings.title: Veritas: Mutable Defaults to Lambda Classes
writings.description: A deep dive into building a Python microframework, exploring the nuances of mutable defaults and metaprogramming.

writings.title: Understanding Malayalam's Agama Sandhi using FSA
writings.description: Modelling the complexities of Malayalam morphology and sandhi rules using Finite State Automata.
